column4: hey guys. i want to have wbar autostart so i made a .desktop file for it and put it in /etc/xdg/autostart. however, since it uses fake transparency, it adapts to the black background that shows up before my wallpaper, not my actual wallpaper. is there any way to change this, like have it not start for a few seconds?
its a known issues, wbar loads before wallpaper is set use -sleep N option in wbar to set the timeout
run wbar with wbar -sleep or wbar -wait i dont remember which
ah. the sleep command is used in your desktop, not in wbar.
wait, there is no sleep parameter for wbar.
there was something like this, hang on let me power my eeepc
hm, cant find it, i'm pretty sure there was something like that in wbar options
i just took a look through, no sucess. let me google it
unfortunately, i run lxde which i am not sure has an autostart file.

According to wbar's author, wbar might try to show itself before the desktop is ready. If the bar comes up looking weird (with window decorations, for example), try adding a short wait, such as sleep 5, just prior to the wbar command in your file.
there you go, lxde uses openbox the autostart file is in /etc/xdg/openbox/autostart.sh
right i tried adding wbar to it to no avail, i just found out lxde has its own.
really? you can try putting it in ~/.xinitrc
